question: Can I see your identification, please?
transcript: Yeah, of course. Here you are. Thank you very much. Thanks so much. So, we can now get started with the first part of the exam. In the first part, I will ask you some personal questions. First, I would like to ask about your hometown.
transcript_original: Yeah, of course. Here you are. Thank you very much. Thanks so much. So, we can now get started with the first part of the exam. In the first part, I will ask you some personal questions. First, I'd like to ask about your hometown.

question: What can a visitor do in your hometown?
transcript: Well, there are thousands of things that a visitor can do in my hometown. As I live in a historical town, the visitor can go sightseeing. There are so many places that a visitor can enjoy taking his time there and spending his time there.
transcript_original: Well, there are thousands of things that a visitor can do in my hometown. As I live in a historical town, the visitor can go sightseeing. There are so many places that a visitor can enjoy taking his time there and spending his time there.

question: And what are the common occupations of people there?
transcript: Well, I guess the main occupation of our city, is making some, how can I say it, traditional stuff, you know. And, you know, and our city is famous for historical materials and stuff.
transcript_original: Um, well, I guess the main occupation of our city, uh, is making some, how can I say it, traditional stuff, you know. And, you know, and our city is famous for historical materials and stuff.

question: Is it a good place for a child growing up there?
transcript: Well, yeah, I guess it is natural and good place for a child to spend his childhood there. And yeah, it is a good place.
transcript_original: Well, yeah, I guess it's natural and good place for a child to spend his childhood there. And yeah, it's a good place.

question: What activities help you to concentrate?
transcript: Well there are a few things that really help me to focus on, and concentrate on different things, and especially studying. The first time, the first thing is probably drinking a bottle of water and trying to relax. I try to take a chill pill before getting started. And yeah.
transcript_original: Um, well there are a few things that really help me to focus on, and concentrate on different things, and especially studying. The first time, the first thing is probably drinking a bottle of water and trying to relax. I try to take a chill pill before getting started. And yeah.

question: And do you think having a routine helps you to concentrate better?
transcript: Yeah, yeah. it is one of those most effective and efficient ways that someone can take into practice and can put into practice to help improve their concentration.
transcript_original: Yeah, yeah. It's one of those most effective and efficient ways that someone can take into practice and can put into practice to help improve their concentration.

question: Is it easy or difficult for you to concentrate?
transcript: It is rather medium, somewhere between difficult and easy. Okay, thank you very much.
transcript_original: Hmm, it's rather medium, somewhere between difficult and easy. Okay, thank you very much.

question: Is fashion important to you?
transcript: Not really much. Actually I have never thought about it. it is a tricky question for me. But sometimes I really care about it. For example when I want to hang out with a special friend, I really care about how I am going to look like.
transcript_original: Not really much. Actually I have never thought about it. It's a tricky question for me. But sometimes I really care about it. For example when I want to hang out with a special friend, I really care about how I'm going to look like.

question: And do you think it is important to be updating your clothes and hair as fashion trends change?
transcript: Well, yeah, it is important, but I really do not think about it that much. I mean, I try to spend a little bit of my time about it.
transcript_original: Well, yeah, it's important, but I really don't think about it that much. I mean, I try to spend a little bit of my time about it.

question: And what kinds of clothes do you like wearing?
transcript: Well, I try to look fine in public. So it does not really matter for me what kind of, what kind of clothes I am going to wear.
transcript_original: Um, well, I try to look fine in public. So it doesn't really matter for me what kind of, what kind of clothes I'm going to wear.

question: Do you understand?
transcript: Yeah, yeah, of course. So now I am giving you a paper, your.
transcript_original: Yeah, yeah, of course. So now I'm giving you a paper, your.

question: Do you want to add more information?
transcript: No, that is just all. Okay, thank you very much. So we can now move on to the third part of the exam. If you can just, hand me the paper and a pen. Thank you. we have been talking about an occasion that you were standing in a line or a queue. And now I want to ask you some questions related to this topic.
transcript_original: No, that's just all. Okay, thank you very much. So we can now move on to the third part of the exam. If you can just, uh, hand me the paper and a pen. Thank you. We've been talking about an occasion that you were standing in a line or a queue. And now I want to ask you some questions related to this topic.

question: Is it very common in your country to have people standing in queues and waiting?
transcript: In some occasions, and yeah of course, for example if you want to buy some dairy purchases, dairy products, groceries, some things we do have every day. Yeah, it is common, it is common and you need to stay in a queue.
transcript_original: In some occasions, and yeah of course, for example if you want to buy some dairy purchases, dairy products, groceries, some things we do have every day. Yeah, it's common, it's common and you need to stay in a queue.

question: Do you think that technology has played an impressive role to reduce waiting time?
transcript: Yeah, of course. In the past few decades, it really has helped a lot because we used to, we used to stand on queues just for taxi or bus. But we do not need to do that anymore and we can get a car right now, we can get a taxi by just, by just using our, phones. Okay, and. it is a, it is a lot more convenient. So do you think that it can, it has also, been effective, when you want to go to banks and supermarkets or using Do you still need to wait for a long time? Well about supermarkets, no I do not think so because there are a lot of groceries and supermarkets all over the country, all over the city that anyone can access easily to these shops and purchase their willing products. Okay.
transcript_original: Yeah, of course. In the past few decades, it really has helped a lot because we used to, we used to stand on queues just for taxi or bus. But we don't need to do that anymore and we can get a car right now, we can get a taxi by just, by just using our, uh, phones. Okay, and uh. It's a, it's a lot more convenient. So do you think that it can, it has also, uh, been effective, uh, when you want to go to banks and supermarkets or using Do you still need to wait for a long time? Well about supermarkets, no I don't think so because there are a lot of groceries and supermarkets all over the country, all over the city that anyone can access easily to these shops and purchase their willing products. Okay.

question: How do you feel when someone breaks the line impatiently?
transcript: It really works on my nerves when someone does that. And what I try to control myself and I just get to that person and alarm them and hey man you have to be more careful because there are a lot of people standing here just to take one of these. So that is all I would do in this situation.
transcript_original: It really works on my nerves when someone does that. And what I try to control myself and I just get to that person and alarm them and hey man you gotta be more careful because there are a lot of people standing here just to take one of these. So that's all I would do in this situation.

question: Okay and what do you think the reaction of other people would be to that?
transcript: Well I guess they will support me because I mean it is a common sense then and you need to fight for your rights.
transcript_original: Um, well I guess they will support me because I mean it's a common sense then and you need to fight for your rights.

question: What hobbies are common in your culture?
transcript: Well, Iranians have always been so interested in having different entertainments. One of the hobbies that is popular among my friends is collecting comic books. I know some people might say that it is not that commonly done among Iranians, but it is. People like collecting different comic books, including comics from other countries.
transcript_original: Well, Iranians have always been so interested in having different entertainments. One of the hobbies that is popular among my friends is collecting comic books. I know some people might say that it's not that commonly done among Iranians, but it is. People like collecting different comic books, including comics from other countries.

question: However, people like collecting other things like, coins or stamps or some artistic people or creative people might, like paintings and drawings.
transcript: Although I think it is, it can be an expensive collection.. Okay.
transcript_original: Although I think it's, uh, it can be an expensive collection. Um. Okay.

question: And are there any hobbies that you think are not worthwhile?
transcript: To be honest, some hobbies can be a real waste of time for me. for example, People collecting baseball cards is not one of my favorites because I am so uninterested in baseball. But of course I cannot say that it cannot be worthwhile for someone who enjoys baseball and likes this hobby. So I think that having a hobby is fine as long as it is not harmful to yourself and other people and as long as you are having fun with it so it is okay and it is worth doing it.
transcript_original: Um, to be honest, some hobbies can be a real waste of time for me. Uh, for example, People collecting baseball cards um, is not one of my favorites because I'm so uninterested in baseball. But of course I cannot say that it can't be worthwhile for uh, someone who enjoys uh, baseball and likes this hobby. So I think that having a hobby is fine as long as it's not harmful to yourself and other people and as long as you're having fun with it so it's okay and it's worth uh, doing it.

question: Okay, and why do you think people have hobbies?
transcript: I think people, have different entertainments, in their free time because they want to relax. After a whole week of working or studying, we all need some time to relax and, enjoy ourselves. also, people might, have hobbies to learn some new skills like, drawing, like, knitting, Or even learning a new language. and the other thing that I can think of is, finding new people and new friends. You can join groups of like-minded people, that have the same hobbies as you do and that can be so great and fun. so I think, these are the reasons why people allocate time to hobbies. Right.
transcript_original: Um, I think people, uh, have different entertainments, um, in their free time because they want to relax. After a whole week of working or studying, we all need some time to relax and, uh, enjoy ourselves.
